definitions.definition: A member of an emergency service who is first on the scene, or among those first on the scene, at an emergency.
A member of an emergency service trained to provide emergency medical care.
The state of being feasible or possible.
An electric-powered scooter, similar in use to a wheelchair, that is specially designed for disabled and/or elderly people.
Money or other goods given as charity.
Distribution; dealing; apportionment.
Payment by the state to the unemployed.
definitions.example: I get my dole paid twice a week.

definitions.definition: A boundary; a landmark.
A void space left in tillage.
To distribute in small amounts; to share out small portions of a meager resource.
Sorrow or grief; dolour.
Dolus.
A line in a poem having five metrical feet.
Poetic metre in which each line has five feet.
One instance of a recurring event.
A room set aside for the use of staff.
definitions.example: Between lessons, the teachers relaxed in the staffroom.

definitions.definition: A place inhabited by a wild animal, often a cave or a hole in the ground.
A shed or shelter for domestic animals.
A place inhabited by a criminal or criminals, a superhero or a supervillain; a refuge, retreat, haven or hideaway.
A bed or resting place.
A grave; a cemetery plot.
To rest; to dwell.
To lay down.
To bury.
A bog; a mire.
To mire.
To become mired.
A person who dresses in a showy but tasteless manner and behaves in a vulgar and conceited way; a show-off.
Useless things to be discarded; rubbish; refuse.
A container into which things are discarded.
Something worthless or of poor quality.
People of low social status or class. (See, for example, white trash or Eurotrash.)
A fan who is excessively obsessed with their fandom and its fanworks.
definitions.example: I am Harry Potter trash.

definitions.definition: Temporary storage on disk for files that the user has deleted, allowing them to be recovered if necessary.
A collar, leash, or halter used to restrain a dog in pursuing game.
To discard.
To make into a mess.
definitions.example: The burglars trashed the house.

definitions.definition: To beat soundly in a game.
To disrespect someone or something
To free from trash, or worthless matter; hence, to lop; to crop.
definitions.example: to trash the rattoons of sugar cane

definitions.definition: To treat as trash, or worthless matter; hence, to spurn, humiliate, or crush.
To hold back by a trash or leash, as a dog in pursuing game; hence, to retard, encumber, or restrain; to clog; to hinder vexatiously.
A broad, deep serving dish used for serving soup or stew.

(law enforcement) The intentional public display before news cameras of someone in police custody, especially someone famous or notorious, for the purpose of satisfying public interest, demonstrating the authorities' effectiveness, or shaming the person.
A form of depression associated with the lack of natural light during the winter months.
A large cowboy hat, not holding ten gallons like the name would suggest but usually around three quarts.
A board on which messages may be posted, especially one in a public space.
A system in which users may send, read and reply to public messages; an electronic message board or forum.
A racer who holds a poor rank or is lapped in a race.
A cord of thin filaments used to clean the areas between the teeth.
Not wholesome; unfavorable to health; unhealthful.
definitions.example: unwholesome air, or food

definitions.definition: Not sound; tainted; defective.
Indicating unsound health; characteristic of or suggesting an unsound condition, physical or mental; repulsive; offensive.
A group of athletes who practice with the team, but do not normally play with the squad, unless called up.
Praise; accolades.
definitions.example: The talented, young playwright received much kudos for his new drama.

definitions.definition: Credit for one's achievements.
A compliment or praise.
A cloud, with a tall structure and a flat base, that is often associated with thunderstorms.
Flair, vitality, or zest; energy; vigor.
definitions.example: The show had a lot of pizzazz, with glittering costumes and upbeat music.

definitions.definition: Tired, having senses dulled by exhaustion.
Regular attendance at a theatre to see plays
Who regularly visits the theatre to see performances
definitions.example: The theatregoing public are up in arms over the new public performance tax.

definitions.definition: A blow to the upper thigh, crushing the muscle against the bone and crushing the nerve cluster next to the quadriceps. Also, the resulting injury.
A lazy or weak person.
An isolated section of pipeline that does not usually carry a flow.
A movement in which the hips and knees are kept straight and stiff and the ankle is flexed.
(shipping) A vehicle that is traveling on a leg of its route in which it does not carry any cargo.
To cause to take place.
definitions.example: The collapse of the gold standard brought about much of the economic turmoil of that era.

definitions.definition: To accomplish, achieve.
definitions.example: I hope to bring about a successful conclusion.

definitions.definition: Someone who works for wages and has little to no professional autonomy
Someone who does very unpleasant or drudging work for a wage
A business providing a service allowing people to meet each other for romantic outings.
A long stick with a sharp tip used as a weapon for throwing or thrusting, or anything used to make a thrusting motion.
A soldier armed with such a weapon; a spearman.
A lance with barbed prongs, used by fishermen to retrieve fish.
An illegal maneuver using the end of a hockey stick to strike into another hockey player.
In professional wrestling, a running tackle in which the wrestler's shoulder is driven into the opponent's midsection.
A shoot, as of grass; a spire.
The feather of a horse.
The rod to which the bucket, or plunger, of a pump is attached; a pump rod.
A long, thin strip from a vegetable.
definitions.example: asparagus and broccoli spears

definitions.definition: To pierce with a spear.
(by extension) To penetrate or strike with, or as if with, any long narrow object; to make a thrusting motion that catches an object on the tip of a long device.
To shoot into a long stem, as some plants do.
Male.
definitions.example: a spear counterpart

definitions.definition: Pertaining to male family members.
definitions.example: the spear side of the family

definitions.definition: A domestic animal, Equus asinus asinus, similar to a horse
A stubborn person
A fool
A small auxiliary engine
A bad poker player
The general well-being of something or someone.
Courage
Chivalrous courtliness, especially towards women
An instance of gallant behaviour or speech
An area around the end of a bridge.
A fortification around the end of a bridge.
An area of ground on the enemy's side of a river or other obstacle, especially one that needs to be taken and defended in order to secure an advance.
Either of the two atoms in different parts of a molecule that are connected by a bridge of two or more other atoms
In a manner contrary to law.
definitions.example: He received a ticket for illegally parking next to a fire hydrant.

definitions.definition: A type of hat with no brim.
(specifically) A tall white hat with no brim of the sort worn by chefs
(by extension) A chef.
A variety of bonnet monkey; toque macaque, Macaca sinica.
An African nominal money of account, equal to 40 cowries.
A knitted hat, usually conical but of varying shape, often woollen, and sometimes topped by a pom-pom or tassel.
A rhythm used in Latin music, especially Cuban religious rituals.
The guitar part of flamenco music.
Any muscle having two heads.
Specifically, the biceps brachii, the flexor of the elbow.
The upper arm, especially the collective muscles of the upper arm.
A point in a metrical pattern that can be filled either with one long syllable (a longum) or two short syllables (two brevia)
The tide at its lowest level for a particular tidal cycle at a certain place.
The time of day when the sea has receded to its lowest level.
A barrel containing gunpowder.
An explosive or otherwise volatile situation.
An unintended consequence of any action in addition to the intended consequence of that action.
An adverse effect, an unintended consequence of a drug or therapy; usually not a beneficial effect.
A change in state caused by a function call (typically "side-effect").
definitions.example: The Eiffel programming language is somewhat purist in insisting that functions have no side effects.

definitions.definition: (family) Of a family relationship that includes mothers, fathers, daughters, sons, grandparents, grandchildren, etc., but not siblings; as opposed to collateral.
Inheriting by direct descent; having the right by direct descent to succeed (to).
Composed of lines; delineated.
definitions.example: lineal designs

definitions.definition: In the direction of a line; of a line; of or relating to a line; measured on, or ascertained by, a line; linear.
definitions.example: lineal magnitude

definitions.definition: An adjectival phrase or clause.
(grammar) Of or relating to or functioning as an adjective.
definitions.example: adjectival noun

definitions.definition: Of or relating to procedure, especially to technicalities thereof.
Someone who attacks.
One of the players on a team in football (soccer) in the row nearest to the opposing team's goal, who are therefore principally responsible for scoring goals.
A long, often knitted, garment worn around the neck.
A headscarf.
A neckcloth or cravat.
To throw on loosely; to put on like a scarf.
To dress with a scarf, or as with a scarf; to cover with a loose wrapping.
A type of joint in woodworking.
A groove on one side of a sewing machine needle.
A dip or notch or cut made in the trunk of a tree to direct its fall when felling.
To shape by grinding.
To form a scarf on the end or edge of, as for a joint in timber, forming a "V" groove for welding adjacent metal plates, metal rods, etc.
To unite, as two pieces of timber or metal, by a scarf joint.
To eat very quickly.
definitions.example: You sure scarfed that pizza.

definitions.definition: A cormorant.
Any bulk raw material constituting the principal input for an industrial process.
definitions.example: Bio-materials may be substituted for petrochemical feedstocks as petroleum prices rise.

definitions.definition: A bunch of feathers, grass or hair, etc., held together at the base.
A cluster of threads drawn tightly through upholstery, a mattress or a quilt, etc., to secure and strengthen the padding.
A small clump of trees or bushes.
A gold tassel on the cap worn by titled undergraduates at English universities.
A person entitled to wear such a tassel.
To provide or decorate with a tuft or tufts.
To form into tufts.
To secure and strengthen (a mattress, quilt, etc.) with tufts.
To be formed into tufts.
A road less frequented than a highway; a byway.
A heavy stick or club, usually used by policemen.
A martial art based on stick fighting originally practiced in India.
definitions.example: Lathi shares its basic principles with other martial arts.

definitions.definition: A kind of telescope mounted so as to have two axes of motion at right angles to each other, one of them parallel to the axis of the Earth, and each carrying a graduated circle, one for measuring declination, and the other right ascension, or the hour angle, so that the telescope may be directed, even in the daytime, to any star or other object whose right ascension and declination are known.
Of, near, or relating to the equator
definitions.example: That plant is best suited to equatorial climates.

definitions.definition: Perpendicular to the plane of a ring
An athletic contest comprising seven events; contested mostly by women, for whom this is an Olympic sport.
A tabular chart of the chemical elements according to their atomic numbers so that elements with similar properties are in the same group (column).
To reduce the offer price of a property after agreeing to a higher one (normally just before contracts are exchanged)
A chamber pot.
Any ailment or disease of the body; especially, a lingering or deep-seated disorder.
A moral or mental defect or disorder.
A corridor in a building that connects rooms.
The navel.
(of animals or plants) To cause to continue or multiply by generation, or successive production
To cause to spread to extend; to impel or continue forward in space
definitions.example: to propagate sound or light

definitions.definition: To spread from person to person; to extend the knowledge of; to originate and spread; to carry from place to place; to disseminate
To multiply; to increase.
To generate; to produce.
To produce young; to be produced or multiplied by generation, or by new shoots or plants
To take effect on all relevant devices in a network.
definitions.example: It takes 24 hours for password changes to propagate throughout the system.

definitions.definition: To cause to take effect on all relevant devices in a network.
definitions.example: The server propagates the password file at midnight each day.

definitions.definition: A break, pause or vacation.
definitions.example: Spring recess offers a good chance to travel.

definitions.definition: An inset, hole, space or opening.
definitions.example: Put a generous recess behind the handle for finger space.

definitions.definition: A time of play during the school day, usually on a playground; break, playtime.
definitions.example: Students who do not listen in class will not play outside during recess.

definitions.definition: A decree of the imperial diet of the old German empire.
A withdrawing or retiring; a moving back; retreat.
definitions.example: the recess of the tides

definitions.definition: The state of being withdrawn; seclusion; privacy.
A place of retirement, retreat, secrecy, or seclusion.
A secret or abstruse part.
definitions.example: the difficulties and recesses of science

definitions.definition: A sinus.
To inset into something, or to recede.
definitions.example: Recess the screw so it does not stick out.

definitions.definition: To take or declare a break.
definitions.example: Class will recess for 20 minutes.

definitions.definition: To appoint, with a recess appointment.
To make a recess in.
definitions.example: to recess a wall

definitions.definition: Remote, distant (in time or place).
Any of various birds of prey of the order Strigiformes that are primarily nocturnal and have forward-looking, binocular vision, limited eye movement, and good hearing.
(by extension) A person seen as having owl-like characteristics, especially appearing wise or serious, or being nocturnally active.
The owl pigeon.
A politician with moderate views that are neither hawkish nor dovish.
Any of various nymphalid butterflies having large eyespots on the wings.
A young owl; owling.
One of a species of small owls, such as Athene noctua.
An owlet moth.
The act of scouting or exploring (especially military or medical) to gain information.
A container filled with decorative plants, suspended on a structure.
The act, process, or state of reinforcing or being reinforced.
A thing that reinforces.
(in the plural) Additional troops or materiel sent to support a military action.
The process whereby a behavior with desirable consequences comes to be repeated.
An unimportant or insignificant person
: the state of not existing; nonexistence
Plastic surgery to the face to remove wrinkles, fat or various signs of aging.
(by extension) Any activity undertaken to renew, revamp, update, or improve the appearance of something.
definitions.example: The old building will get a facelift with new paint, carpet, and decoration.

definitions.definition: To perform a facelift upon.
To burn something to ashes.
To incinerate a dead body (as an alternative to burial).
(of liquids) To heat to the point where it begins to turn into a gas.
definitions.example: Boil some water in a pan.

definitions.definition: To cook in boiling water.
definitions.example: Boil the eggs for three minutes.

definitions.definition: (of liquids) To begin to turn into a gas, seethe.
definitions.example: Pure water boils at 100 degrees Celsius.

definitions.definition: To bring to a boil, to heat so as to cause the contents to boil.
(used only in progressive tenses, of weather) To be uncomfortably hot.
definitions.example: It’s boiling outside!

definitions.definition: (used only in progressive tenses) To feel uncomfortably hot.
definitions.example: I’m boiling in here – could you open the window?

definitions.definition: To form, or separate, by boiling or evaporation.
definitions.example: to boil sugar or salt

definitions.definition: To steep or soak in warm water.
To be agitated like boiling water; to bubble; to effervesce.
definitions.example: the boiling waves of the sea

definitions.definition: To be moved or excited with passion; to be hot or fervid.
definitions.example: His blood boils with anger.

definitions.definition: The process of changing the state of a substance from liquid to gas by heating it to its boiling point.
An animation style with constantly changing wavy outlines, giving a shimmering or wobbling appearance.
That boils or boil.
definitions.example: boiling kettle  boiling oil

definitions.definition: Of a thing: extremely hot or active.
definitions.example: The radiator is boiling – I’m going to turn it down a bit.

definitions.definition: Of a person: feeling uncomfortably hot.
definitions.example: I’m boiling – can’t we open a window?

definitions.definition: Of the weather: very hot.
definitions.example: It’s boiling out today!

definitions.definition: (of adjectives associated with heat) Extremely
definitions.example: He was boiling mad.

definitions.definition: Exhibiting symmetry; having harmonious or proportionate arrangement of parts; having corresponding parts or relations.
A seaman; mariner; skipper.
The person or organization that ships (sends) something.
definitions.example: The shipper should have paid for insurance on the package, because it was damaged when it arrived.

definitions.definition: A box for shipping something fragile, such as bottled beer or wine.
A person who supports a romantic or sexual relationship between fictional characters or real people.
A style of popular dance music from the West Indies.
To take or seize; to take hold of.
To take hold of with the understanding, that is, to conceive in the mind; to become cognizant of; to understand; to recognize; to consider.
To anticipate; especially, to anticipate with anxiety, dread, or fear; to fear.
To think, believe, or be of opinion; to understand; to suppose.
To be apprehensive; to fear.
A hard outer structure that provides both structure and protection to creatures such as insects and Crustacea.
A radio programme format with discussions about topical issues.
To retreat.
To fail to fulfil a promise or purpose.
An image of a person constructed out of bits of photographs of other people; a facial composite.
definitions.example: The witness was called in to create a photofit resembling her memory of the attacker.

definitions.definition: Satisfied with oneself, especially over-satisfied; smug; slightly arrogant.
definitions.example: He stood back and looked at his project with a self-satisfied expression.

definitions.definition: An ordinance issued on the authority of the head of the executive branch of government.
Any flowering plant of the genus Geranium, the cranesbills, of family Geraniaceae.
The common name for flowering plants of the genus Pelargonium.
A bright red color tinted with orange, like that of a scarlet geranium.
Of a bright red color tinted with orange, like that of a scarlet geranium.
A chaotic and unpleasant or violent situation.
Considerable backlash from the public.
Land, specifically, an open field, on which livestock is kept for feeding.
Ground covered with grass or herbage, used or suitable for the grazing of livestock.
Food, nourishment.
To move animals into a pasture.
To graze.
To feed, especially on growing grass; to supply grass as food for.
definitions.example: The farmer pastures fifty oxen; the land will pasture forty cows.

definitions.definition: The part of the academic year in which classes are held.
A source of inspiration.
A poet; a bard.
An act of musing; a period of thoughtfulness.
To become lost in thought, to ponder.
To say (something) with due consideration or thought.
To think on; to meditate on.
To wonder at.
A gap or hole in a hedge, fence, etc. through which a wild animal is accustomed to pass; a muset.
definitions.example: Find a hare without a muse. (old proverb)

definitions.definition: A kind of drama having a musical accompaniment to intensify the effect of certain scenes.

A drama abounding in romantic sentiment and agonizing situations, with a musical accompaniment only in parts which are especially thrilling or pathetic. In opera, a passage in which the orchestra plays a somewhat descriptive accompaniment, while the actor speaks
definitions.example: the melodrama in the grave digging scene of Beethoven's "Fidelio".

definitions.definition: Any situation or action which is blown out of proportion.
Indecision in speech or action.
Changing location by moving back and forth.
A gift certificate in the form of a card issued by retailers as an alternative to a non-monetary gift, allowing the bearer to purchase goods up to its face value.
Any of a variety of thermoplastics created from nitrocellulose and camphor, once used as photographic film.
(often used attributively) The genre of cinema; film.
Any of several large ground-dwelling rodents of the genera Marmota and Cynomys in the squirrel family.
To sell or guarantee more seats for (an event) than actually exist.
